snippet: Members of a House committee on Thursday asked the head of the agency to explain long security lines and claims of retaliation against whistle-blowers.
abstract: Transportation Security Administration administrator Peter V Neffenger appears before House Oversight Committee and is criticized by representatives about longstanding and continuing problems at agency, including long lines at airport security and alleged punishment of whistle-blowers.
lead_paragraph: Members of a House committee on Thursday asked the head of the agency to explain long security lines and claims of retaliation against whistle-blowers.

headline.main: Congress’s List of Gripes With T.S.A. Is Long, Like an Airport Security Line
headline.print_headline: List of Gripes With T.S.A. Is Long, Like Airport Security Lines
